page.title: 18TRANSPORT IN SWINDERBY.
page.content: Many residents of Swinderby have a {bicycle }for use locally and most families have at least one{car.}This may belong to their employer. Many ladies have a small car for shopping, taking the children to school,going to work and other activities. The {railway station}is north of the village.Trains run regularly to Newark and Lincoln with connections to all parts of the country. Before 1980 there was a{bus}through the village only on a Wednesday and Friday.The service has slowly improved and now buses run hourly from 7.24am to 7.34pm to Newark, 5 of these go to Manchester. The first bus to Lincoln leaves at 7.34am. and the last leaves at 10.17pm. In January 1985 the bus routes were changed to include Collingham, so the Library and Doctors Health Centre can be reached easily.
